results.title: Guitar legends: the ultimate anthology
results.brief_description: This disc contains twelve songs from an array of British rock groups, presenting the influence of guitar, and guitarists on popular music, through an array of live performances. The tracks are: Paul Kosso/Free “Alright now”; Andy Powell/Wishbone Ash “Phoenix”; Robin Trower “Night of the guitars”; Ritchie Blackmore/Deep Purple “Improvisation”; Rory Gallagher “Could have had religion”; John Etheridge/Soft Machine “Tale of Taliesin ; Jan Akermann/Focus “Hocus pocus”; Vernon Reed/Jack Bruce “Sunshine of your love”; Steve Hackett “Clocks” ; Steve Howe “Clap”; Mick Box/Uriah Heep “The Magician’s birthday”; Tony Iommi/Black Sabbath “Headless cross”.

results.title: Guinea pigs
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “About Animals”.
Children learn that guinea pigs are affectionate animals who seem to like being with people and are easy to care for and handle. Basic facts about selective breeding are introduced as the children observe the varied colourings and markings of guinea pigs.

results.title: Guinea gold
results.brief_description: This film presents the early history of the Bulolo goldfields in the northwestern part of what is known today as the Territory of Papua New Guinea. The gold prospectors were the explorers of this rugged country mandated to Australia by the League of Nations. The film records primitive native life of the area as it was discovered by them - a people with unique customs living in a stone-age environment. Shows the discovery of alluvial gold in the Bulolo Valley and the construction of the first dredges, every part of which was flown in three tons at a time over the mountains from Lae in three-engined Junkers aircraft. The role of the aircraft is shown to be basic in the development of the resources of the Bulolo Valley, and the valley itself with its wealth of alluvial gold was a basic part of the economic and industrial development of pre-war New Guinea.

results.title: Guanaco of Patagonia
results.creator_credit: Megan Epler and William L. Franklin
results.brief_description: A study pf the unique social system of the guanaco, a camel-like animal found in Patagonia, in which family groups aggressively defend fixed territories and expel dependent yearlings.

results.title: Gruesome gray monster (Finding colours)
results.brief_description: Designed to sharpen perception and appreciation of colour. Shows the experiences of a young girl who goes to the castle of the gruesome gray monster to recover the colours he has stolen from the world.

results.title: Growth: a study of Johnny and Jimmy. Part 3
results.creator_credit: Warden and Gilbert at Columbia University
results.brief_description: A study of the development of selected activities common to growing infants. Twin boys are selected and the influence of exercise on the development of each motor function at a number of age levels is studied. During the first 22 months Johnny is kept in a crib and then between the 22 to 25 month period was given intensive exercise. The complex interdependence of practice and maturation in development is illustrated. Reel 1: Development of creeping, development of the sitting position, development of erect locomotion, development in the assumption of an erect posture. Reel 2: A lure is suspended beyond the child’s reach in order to appraise his ability to manipulate pedestals so that he can climb up to obtain the object. Reel 3: in some behaviour activities not only attitude but also neuromotor performance are affected by exercise or restriction of funtion. The following are studies: Swimming behaviour and ascending inclines.

results.title: Growth of motor behaviour
results.brief_description: Short film in the Encyclopaedia Britannica series. Using Yale footage this shows motor or muscular development of a child between 4 weeks and 4 years through rolling, sitting, standing, walking and climbing stairs and riding a bike.
